content.text:
The Eliza project has seen numerous updates across various areas including bug fixes, feature additions, refactoring, and documentation improvements.

Bug fixes include handling short text items in knowledge processing (#3652), fixing Twitter client embedding dimension (#3625, #3659, #3668), resolving social vitest issues (#3622), addressing pglite & migrations problems (#3672), fixing extension and migrations (#3665), and handling speaker removal in Twitter spaces (#3662).

Feature additions include adding database and plugin adapter types to core types (#3640), adding participant error handling (#3671), implementing space action functionality (#3655), adding agent server options with middleware settings (#3648), and adding multi-tenancy with a new 'agent' table while renaming 'user' to 'entity' table (#3637). A new feature was also added to check if plugins are installed and display the result (#3660).

Refactoring efforts include reorganizing API routes into a file-based structure (#3651), cleaning up the server (#3667), refactoring the plugin-local-ai component (#3663), and improving memory queries, knowledge metadata, and browser support (#3606).

Documentation updates include fixing formatting in plugins.md (#3649), updating README_KOR.md (#3670), and fixing typographical errors in documentation (#3656).

Additionally, a release update (0.25.8) was merged from develop to main branch (#3522).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several new features and improvements have been proposed to the elizaOS/eliza repository through recent pull requests:

1. A new storage plugin called 'storacha' has been introduced by fforbeck in PR #3657.

2. Agent server options with middleware settings have been added by v1xingyue in PR #3648, enhancing server configuration capabilities.

3. The UserRapport feature (PR #3647) by nusk0 aims to improve Twitter interactions with more tailored responses and better rapport building with users.

4. A refactoring of API routes into a file-based structure has been implemented by wtfsayo in PR #3651, likely improving code organization and maintainability.

5. X4ndar has submitted a pull request (#3666) titled 'Stable', though specific details about this PR are not provided in the source.

6. A refactoring of the local-ai plugin has been completed by AIFlowML in PR #3663, marked as 'plugin-local-ai-final'.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed increased activity over a two-day period. From February 24-25, 2025, there were 10 new pull requests with 7 merged and 16 active contributors. Activity increased the following day (February 25-26, 2025) with 13 new pull requests, 15 merged PRs, 2 new issues, and 17 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained strong development momentum with consistent contributor engagement.
sources: From 2025-02-24 to 2025-02-25, elizaos/eliza had 10 new PRs (7 merged), 0 new issues, and 16 active contributors.
From 2025-02-25 to 2025-02-26, elizaos/eliza had 13 new PRs (15 merged), 2 new issues, and 17 active contributors.

Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Two recent issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository:

1. Issue #3664: A user named suryanshkushwaha reported a problem with RAG Knowledge causing a JavaScript Heap Out of Memory error.

2. Issue #3661: A user named avdheshcharjan reported an issue with the Docker file, specifically related to an invalid cachestore.

Both issues are currently open in the repository and require attention from the development team.
